content.question: The complete Lewis electron-dot diagram for <math alttext="H C O N H 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>HCONH</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> is shown above. Identify the hybridization of the valence orbitals for the carbon atom and the approximate hydrogen-carbon-nitrogen bond angle according to <math alttext="V S E P R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>VSEPR</mtext></math> theory.

choices.label: <math alttext="s p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>s</mi><mi>p</mi></math> hybridized and <math alttext="180 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>180</mn><mo>°</mo></math>

<math alttext="s p 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>s</mi><msup><mi>p</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math> hybridized and <math alttext="120 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>120</mn><mo>°</mo></math>

<math alttext="s p 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>s</mi><msup><mi>p</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math> hybridized and <math alttext="180 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>180</mn><mo>°</mo></math>

<math alttext="s p 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>s</mi><msup><mi>p</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></math> hybridized and <math alttext="120 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>120</mn><mo>°</mo></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="s p 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>s</mi><msup><mi>p</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math> hybridized and <math alttext="120 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>120</mn><mo>°</mo></math>

skill.text: 1.A: Describe the components of and quantitative information from models and representations that illustrate particulate-level properties only.
